title: The Discipline of Perception
content: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. When you wake up in the morning, tell yourself: The people I deal with today will be meddling, ungrateful, arrogant, dishonest, jealous, and surly.

title: On Death and Impermanence
content: Remember that very little disturbs the balance of a well-ordered soul. Death smiles at us all, but all a man can do is smile back. Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

title: The Inner Citadel
content: Confine yourself to the present. The universe is transformation; our life is what our thoughts make it. You can commit injustice by doing nothing.

title: On Virtue and Excellence
content: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy. Be like the rocky headland on which the waves constantly break. It stands firm, and round it the seething waters are laid to rest.

title: The View from Above
content: Remember that in a little while you and everyone you know will be dead. And soon after that, even your name will be forgotten. Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate associates you.

title: On Rational Nature
content: Adapt yourself to the life you've been given, but love the people with whom you share it. Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is perspective, not truth.

title: The Common Good
content: What is not good for the swarm is not good for the bee. We were born to work together like feet, hands, and eyes, like the two rows of teeth, upper and lower.

title: The Discipline of Action
content: You can commit injustice by doing nothing. In the morning when thou risest unwillingly, let this thought be present - I am rising to the work of a human being.

title: The Cosmic Perspective
content: Consider that everything is opinion. Observe constantly that all things take place by change, and accustom thyself to consider that the nature of the universe loves nothing so much as to change existing things.

title: On Anger and Forgiveness
content: Whenever you want to cheer yourself, consider the good qualities of your companions. How much trouble he avoids who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does.

title: The Discipline of Desire
content: Never esteem anything as of advantage to you that will make you break your word or lose your self-respect. At dawn, when you have trouble getting out of bed, tell yourself: 'I have to go to work â€” as a human being.'

title: On Time and Mortality
content: Time is like a river of vanishing opportunities and the current is swift. There is nothing lasting in all that comes to pass - no, nothing that is not swept away.

title: On Justice and Wisdom
content: The four cardinal virtues: wisdom, justice, courage, and temperance. Let no day pass without a line - without study. Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.

title: The Art of Living
content: Confine yourself to the present. Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one. The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.

title: On Inner Peace
content: Remember that very little disturbs the balance of a well-ordered mind. The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious. Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
